title: Punishment for Murder
description: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.
cases: Bachan Singh v. State of Punjab (Rarest of Rare Doctrine)
K.M. Nanavati v. State of Maharashtra (Grave & Sudden Provocation)

title: Theft
description: Whoever, intending to take dishonestly any movable property out of the possession of any person without that person's consent, moves that property in order to such taking, is said to commit theft.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years or fine or both
cases: Pyare Lal Bhargava v. State of Rajasthan
K.N. Mehra v. State of Rajasthan

title: Sexual Intercourse by Deceitful Means
description: Sexual intercourse by employing deceitful means or making false promise to marry.
cases: Anurag Soni v. State of Chhattisgarh
Deelip Singh v. State of Bihar

title: Attempt to Murder
description: Whoever does any act with such intention or knowledge, and under such circumstances that, if death were caused, would amount to murder, shall be punished.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years or Life + Fine
cases: Two held on charge of murder attempt – Pune scrap vendors case under BNS 109
3 arrested for abduction & attempt to murder – Bhamboli village extortion case

title: Voluntarily Causing Hurt
description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt shall be punished.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year or Fine or Both

title: Wrongful Restraint
description: Whoever voluntarily obstructs any person so as to prevent that person from proceeding in any direction in which that person has a right to proceed commits wrongful restraint.
punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month or Fine or Both

title: Criminal Breach of Trust
description: Whoever, being entrusted with property or dominion over property, dishonestly misappropriates or converts it to own use commits criminal breach of trust.
cases: Case against supplier for duping firm of ₹8.3 lakh – Criminal breach & cheating charges

title: Cheating
description: Whoever, by deceiving any person, fraudulently or dishonestly induces delivery of property or consent, commits cheating.
cases: Woman books kin for cheating her of ₹25 lakh – Pune cheating case
Four family members booked for cheating Dighi resident of ₹13.5 lakh

title: Cheating by Personation
description: Whoever cheats by pretending to be some other person commits cheating by personation.

title: Snatching
description: Whoever, intending to commit theft, suddenly or quickly seizes movable property from a person commits snatching.

title: Robbery
description: Theft or extortion becomes robbery when committed by causing or attempting to cause death, hurt, or wrongful restraint.
punishment: Rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years + Fine
cases: Uttarakhand first FIR under BNS included robbery charge at Haridwar railway area

title: Attempt to Commit Robbery or Dacoity when Armed with Deadly Weapon
description: Whoever attempts to commit robbery or dacoity while armed with a deadly weapon shall be punished.

title: Culpable Homicide
description: Whoever causes death with the intention of causing death or such bodily injury as is likely to cause death shall be punished.
cases: Bombay High Court holds BNS predicate offences under PMLA include culpable homicide provisions
